title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
"i get a green light on charger"
Doesn't change to orange?

Check resistance to ground on PM_PWRBTN_L and R1405.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
it does change to orange
pm_pwrbtn_l = 3.4v
r1405 looks fine and has proper resistance

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
"PM_PWRBTN_L = 0v
---------------
pm_pwrbtn_l = 3.4v"
When can we trust your values???

Use R5115/16 to simulate power on and see if PM_PWRBTN_L drops.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: ok so i simulated a power on and pm_pwrbtn_l drops to 0V i did solder a wire between pins of r5115 to test.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
So SMC send power on signal to PCH.

"SMC_ADAPTER_EN = 0v"
PCH requires high level.
Check it again...
Do you have original charger (at least 60W)?

message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN = 3.4v
yes using a 85W original.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
PCH seems to have all powers and signals required to start.
You must also check RTC signals, tu be sure all is there.
PM_SLP_S5/4_L no reaction at R5115/16?
Use an o-scope to catch any rapid pulse there...

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
RTC_RESET_L = 3.3v

PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3v

PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 = .41v

PCH_INTRUDER_L = 3.053v

PCH_INTVRMEN = 3.2v

I do not own an o-scope any other way to check? i suppose if thats the only way to get this working ill have to get one. what do u suggest?

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
DC voltage seems to be correct (0.4-0.45V); but is not 100% sure...

"PM_SLP_S5/4_L no reaction at R5115/16?"
If no reaction, PCH should be bad.
You can try reflow it, with good flux; 180-200 degrees should be good enough.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
i do get a reaction

PM_SLP_S5_L spikes up t 3.3v when i short r5115

PM_SLP_S4_L spikes up to 0.72v

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
Using o-scope you probably catch 3V pulse for PM_SLP_S4 too.
Also check if PM_SLP_S3_L pulses.
Next, check for pulse on every power supply (big coils) controlled by these sleep signals...
Check if ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses too.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD Pulses
PM_SLP_S4_L Pulses

checked all the coils only ones that didnt pulse were L3095 and l7701.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
So you get pulses at VCORE too.
Check at pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
Also try new BIOS...

i do get a pulse on vcore
also pulse on 7 and 3 of u1950 3.3v pulse

new bios did nothing

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: Check all SPI termination resistors and traces to PCH and U6100.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: All resistors and traces on spi termination to pch and u6100 are fine.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
Did you try BIOS file from the forum?
Clean ME dump is already posted for this kind of board for sure...

title: 820-00165 no fan spin

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
YouTube should have many videos about using o-scopes.
Apart of names, there is not too much difference between cheap digital o-scopes.
Usually, auto mode should be good enough.

[url]https://www.eevblog.com/[/url] has good reviews and explanations about million of electronic tools...
I think they have some tricks to extend frequency range too (by software).

figured out the oscope a bit and going back to the question

"PM_SLP_S5/4_L no reaction at R5115/16?
Use an o-scope to catch any rapid pulse there..."

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
OK, check now for pulse at L7520.
If PM_SLP_S3_L pulses too, yo should get pulses at all the other coils; less the CPU ones maybe...

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: i get pulses on l7520 and PM_SLP_S3_L and checked other coils before i got pulses on all of them except the backlight coil

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
Post voltages for U6100 pins.
O-scope should show some activity at pins 2, 5, 6.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: pin 2,5 and 6 do show activity o-scope says 36v seems odd but multimeter shows 3.3v on those pins rest of the pins are 3.3v according to multimeter except pin 4 of course

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
When PCH access SPI chip, pins 5 & 6 go low.
Even pin2 should drop to 1-2V I think.

Seems that you do not read correctly your o-scope.
Be aware of gain probe. It should have gain control on the probe and software too.

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message:
ok well i had the max voltage too high o-scope showing 3.60v on those pins now. when i trigger smc_onoff_l i get a pulse but voltage stays the same. i do see a slight fluctuation of 3.60v to 3.80v on u6100.

does this mean the pch is not reading the bios then?

title: 820-00165 no fan spin
message: Do you get 24MHz at R1915?
